principles.name: Profit Maximization
principles.description: The primary goal of a business is to maximize profits for shareholders.
principles.explanation: While important, focusing solely on profit can lead to short-term thinking and neglect of other stakeholders.

principles.name: Cash Flow Principle
principles.description: Cash is king - a business needs positive cash flow to survive.
principles.explanation: Even profitable companies can fail if they run out of cash to pay their obligations.

principles.name: Employee Engagement
principles.description: Engaged employees are more productive and loyal to the company.
principles.explanation: Investing in employee satisfaction can lead to higher retention and productivity.

principles.name: Company Culture
principles.description: A strong, positive culture attracts and retains top talent.
principles.explanation: Culture is set from the top and influences every aspect of how a company operates.

principles.name: Product-Market Fit
principles.description: A product must meet the needs of its target market to succeed.
principles.explanation: Without product-market fit, even the best execution will fail.

principles.name: Blue Ocean Strategy
principles.description: Create uncontested market space rather than competing in existing markets.
principles.explanation: Finding new markets can lead to rapid growth without direct competition.

principles.name: Corporate Governance
principles.description: The system of rules and practices by which a company is directed and controlled.
principles.explanation: Good governance ensures accountability and alignment between management and shareholders.

principles.name: Leadership Excellence
principles.description: Effective leadership inspires and guides the organization toward its goals.
principles.explanation: Great leaders create vision, build strong teams, and make tough decisions when needed.
